Function reference

All functions

aggregate_time()
Aggregate time series table
calc_fdc()
Calculate Flow Duration Curve (FDC)
calc_fdc_rsr()
Calculate RSR for Flow Duration Curve Segments
calc_gof()
Calculate a goodness-of-fit table
conc_to_load()
Convert concentration and discharge time series into a load time series.
copy_file_version()
Copy a file with an optional version suffix.
filter_period()
Filter a time period for a variable time series table.
group_hydr_values()
Group the values of a parameter in the file hydrology.hyd.
id_to_run()
Convert run ID values to run names
id_to_unit()
Generate 'unit' condition for parameter definition from ID vector
initialize_softcal()
Initialize a soft calibration workflow
load_to_conc()
Convert load and discharge time series into a concentration time series.
plot_dotty()
Plot Dotty
plot_dotty_yields()
Plot Dotty Yields
plot_gof()
Plot goodness of fit (GOF) tables
plot_parameter_identifiability()
Plot Parameter Identifiability
plot_phu_yld_bms()
Plot PHU, yield, and biomass over days to maturity
prepare_plant_parameter()
Rearrange parameter change tables to SWATrunR format
rank_gof()
Rank lines in a table of goodness-of-fit values.
remove_unsuccesful_runs()
Remove Unsuccessful Runs from Simulation
run_to_id()
Convert run_names to integer ID values
sample_days_mat()
Sample days to maturity values
sample_lhs()
Sample parameters with Latin Hypercube Sampling (LHS)
sample_oat()
Sample parameter values one-at-a-time (OAT)
sum_variables()
Sum values of simulated variables
translate_to_boundaries()
Translate the normalized sampled values of a parameter to ranges of groups of that parameter (e.g. when perco should have different ranges based on the initial values of perco in all HRUs)
update_par()
Update Parameters
write_cal_file()
Write Calibration File
add_timestamp()
Add a time stamp to the save name
calc_wyr()
Calculate water yield ratio
plot_esco_epco()
Plot esco (and epco) to identify appropriate parameter ranges.
initialize_hardcal()
Initialize a hard calibration workflow
plot_oat()
Function to plot OAT (One-At-A-Time) analysis results
plot_timeseries()
Plot time series of simulation results and observations
view_timeseries()
View interactive time series of simulation results and observations

Developed by Svajunas Plunge, Christoph Schuerz, Michael Strauch, MikoÅ‚aj Piniewski.
